page_content:
Compound Instruments - Processing Behaviour

Version:MissionOS_2.0

Processing behavior determine how the compound instrument behave when one or more child readings are missing. Processing behavior is applicable for both Composite and Derived Instruments.

The processing behavior can be of two types –

  • BLOCKING (data for every child is required within the buffer to form a master/parent reading) or
  • NON-BLOCKING (As long as the controlling child reading is present then a master/parent reading will form with whatever child readings are available in the buffer. The missing children will simply be skipped in the loop calculation. Children with Calculate Fail errors will also be skipped).

 

 

 

Blocking/Non-blocking processing behavior can be configured in three ways (explained more further below):

  1. When creating a derived instrument though the user interface Processing Behavior is chosen from a dropdown.,
  2. When creating a new composite instrument via the user interface, processing behaviour is set in the new window that appears after the Composite Instruments checkbox is ticked
  3. In a regular setup file. To enable the Processing Behaviour column in the setup file you must make sure the option is enabled (checkbox) in model setup. In the Manage Setup File tab, if the checkbox is not enabled, the column won’t appear in the setup file and default behaviour of BLOCKING will be applied.

 

 Method 1

  1. First select the instruments from Instrument Selection panel of Instrument Data
  2. Click Create Group.
  3. You navigate to Instrumentation > Setup > Display Group page in Data Manager.

Here while creating the group, you can find Processing Behavior represented through a dropdown field with 2 options – BLOCKING and NON-BLOCKING. Refer to Figure 3 to view this:

 

 

 

Method 2

Perform the following steps to configure Processing Behavior in Instrument Setup:

  1. Navigate to Data Manager > Instrumentation > Setup > Instrument.
  2. Enter the required fields, as you do for instrument setup. (Refer to the manual on Instrument Setup for more details)
  1. Select the Composite Instrument.
    New fields populate for creating children.
  1. Select the Processing Behavior from the dropdown.

 

 

 

 

Method 3

  1. Go to Admin > Data Object Configuration > Object Definition.
  2. Select the Model
  3. Select Class Type, Class, Type and Subtype.
  4. Click Manage Setup File.
  5. Here, the Processing Behavior is represented by a checkbox.
  6. If the checkbox is not selected, the Processing Behavior is considered in default state as BLOCKING.
  7. Select the checkbox to change the Processing Behavior to NON-BLOCKING.
